document.masterDocTitle: Riegeriana, a new genus for Physopelta apicalis, and checklist of the genus Iphita (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Largidae) with description of one new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Riegeriana, a new genus for Physopelta apicalis, and checklist of the genus Iphita (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Largidae) with description of one new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Entomology, Moravian Museum, Hviezdoslavova 29 a, CZ- 627 00 Brno-Slatina, Czech Republic.
Department of Etomology, National Museum, Kunratice 1, CZ- 148 00 Praha 4, Czech Republic.

bibRefCitation.author: Stal
bibRefCitation.refString: Stal, C. (1870) Enumeratio Hemipterorum. Bidrag till en fortecking ofver alla hittills kanda Hemiptera, jemte systematiska meddelanden. 1. Kungliga Svenska Vetenskapsakademiens Handlingar (N. F.), 9 (1), 1 - 232. http: // dx. doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 12549

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 20–24. 20–23—
Iphita lata
sp. nov.
: 20–21—male, holotype, India: Tamil Nadu: Coimbatore (20—dorsal view, 21—ventral view), 22–23—female, paratype, India: Kerala: Walayar forest (22—dorsal view, 23—detail of pronotum in most exposed view). 24—
Iphita coimbatorensis (Distant, 1919)
, female, India: Kerala: Pompa, Sabramila, detail of pronotum in most exposed view. (Photos: 20–22—L. Macháčková, 23–24—P. Kment).

FIGURES 25–29.
Iphita limbata
Stål, 1870
. 25–26, 28–29—male, India: Arunachal Pradesh (25—dorsal view, 26—ventral view, 28—procoxae, 29—detail of procoxa, schematic). 27—female, India: Arunachal Pradesh, dorsal view. (Photos: P. Kment).

FIGURES 30–34.
Iphita limbata Stål, 1870
, male, India: Arunachal Pradesh: 30–31—procoxae (30—magnification 32×, 31–47×); 32–33—profemur (two different views: 32–25×, 33–18×); 34—external scent efferent system and middle leg (15×). Scale bars: 0.5 mm (Figs 30–31), 1 mm (Figs 32–34). (SEM micrographs: P. Kment).

paragraph.emphasis:
Material examined.
BANGLADESH : Dacca [= Dhaka], 9 . v.1945, 1 ♀, D. Leston lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( BMNH ).
CAMBODIA :
Cambodge , 13 . iv.1919, 1 ♀, Boubee lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( MNHN ).

Qiongzhong county, at light, 7 . vii.1984, 1 ♀, Yuanfu Liu lgt., C.-Q. Gao det. ( NKUM ).

Mengla, 17 . ix.1979, 2 ♀♀, Z.-P. Ling & H.-G. Zou lgt. ( NKUM );

Xiaomengyang, Jinghong city, 850 m a.s.l., 8 . iv. 1957, 2 ♂♂ 1 ♀, Q.-Zh. Liang lgt.; same locality, 4 . iv.1957, 1 ♀, G.-J. Hong lgt.; same locality, 6 .
iv.1957, 1
♂, G.-J. Hong lgt., all T.-Y. Hsiao det. ( NKUM ).

Haut-Tonkin et Bas-Yunnan [= Upper Tonkin and Lower Yunnan], entre [= among] Man-Hao [= Manhao, Yunnan], Muong-Hum (prés Lao-Kay [= near Lao Cai]) [Lao Cai Province, Vietnam ] et [= and] Ban-Nam-Coun [= Ban Nam Coun, Lai Chau Province, Vietnam ], 1905, 1 ♀, Lieut. Lesourt lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( MNHN ).

Assam- Arunachal border, Bhalukpong, 27 °00′ 48 ″N 92 ° 39 ′08″E, 150 m a.s.l., 1 .– 8 .
v.2012, 1
♂ 1 ♀, L. Dembický lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( NMPC ).

ca. 55 km W of Balikpatan,
01° 18.3 ′S
116 °21.0′E
, PT Fajar Surya Swadaya (area), border of
Acacia magna
plantation and primary rainforest stream and waterfall, puddles, individual collecting + light trap, 100 m a.s.l., 24 .– 25 . +
29 .xi. 2011
, J. Hájek, J. Schneider and P. Votruba lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( NMPC ).

Shan States, 1 ♀, Malideus lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( BMNH : Distant Coll.).
Tanintharyi Region: Upper Tenasserim, 2 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀, J. L. Stehlík & P. Kment det. ( BMNH : Distant Coll.).

, Madon lgt., J. L. Stehlík det. ( ISNB ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. China (Hainan, Yunnan) (
Hsiao 1964
,
Liu 1981
,
Situ & Zheng 1983
,
Hua 2000
,
Votýpka et al. 2010
), Bangladesh (
Stål 1870
,
Maxwell-Lefroy 1909
), Cambodia (this paper), India (Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Karnataka, Kerala, Meghalaya, Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, West Bengal) (e.g.
Stål 1870
,
Distant 1903
,
Breddin 1909
,
Maxwell-Lefroy 1909
,
Blöte 1931
,
Schmidt 1931
,
Zamal & Chopra 1990
,
Sen et al. 1994
,
Abdul Rasheed & Gokuldas 2002
,
Pemila et al. 2003
,
Saha & Bal 2007
,
Stehlík 2007 b
), Indonesia (Kalimantan, Sumatra) (this paper), Malaysia (Tioman Island) (this paper), Myanmar (Tenasserim) ( Distant 1879 , 1903 ), Laos (
Stehlík 2005
), Nepal (Stehlík 2003 ), Thailand (
Stehlík & Jindra 2003
), Vietnam (new record).

Note. The record from Assam, North Khási Hills by
Distant ( 1903 )
refers to Meghalaya. The record from Indonesia (Sumatra) by Breddin ( 1901 ) was based on misidentification of
I. varians varians
(see
Breddin 1909
).
Stehlík & Jindra ( 2003 , with ‘?’)
, and
Stehlík ( 2005 )
listed the species also from Indonesia (Sumatra) without providing any exact records; these records are confirmed here. From Hainan it was recorded only by
Hua ( 2000 )
without exact locality; here we provide a first exact locality.
